Authors: Ranti K.S., Salim K., Girsang A.S.
Title: Clustering steam user behavior data using K-Prototypes algorithm
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Materials Science and Engineering
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ranti, K.S., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Salim, K., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Girsang, A.S., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The usage of user telemetry to gather player behavioral data on video games can be very beneficial to game developers with a certain business model. With the help of user telemetry in game development, it can provide access to data on user behavior from installed game clients' platform such as Steam. These behavioral data can be used to find out the Steam user behavioral patterns on playtime distributions that can be studied by developers in order to have a deeper understanding of the behaviors of their players. In this study, the data are clustered using the k-prototypes algorithm, a combination of k-means and k-modes algorithm that can be used to cluster mixed attributes. The result shows that the clusters represent the types and preferences of the players. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.

Authors: Salim K., Damayanti L., Puspita M., Liujaya S., Girsang A.S.
Title: Data warehouse using Kimball approach in computer maniac
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Materials Science and Engineering
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Salim, K., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Damayanti, L., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Puspita, M., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Liujaya, S., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Girsang, A.S., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: It is difficult for small businesses to evolve without utilizing an adequate system which is able to manage information within the business entity efficiently. The reporting system commonly used utilizes query which consumes a large amount of time in order to generate results fulfilling requirements set by the user. In order to simplify and speed up reporting in digital world and eventually results in improvement of business, the business entity needs a system which can address problems quickly and easily. In this paper, data warehouse system which could simplify and speed up the reporting provisions that is needed by the business without having to modify the existing query being implemented. With Kimball approaches, the data to be reported could be customized in various forms in accordance with the requirements set by the entity. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.

Authors: Ranti K.S., Salim K., Yuliyono A.D., Girsang A.S.
Title: Clustering behavioral data for advertising purposes using K-prototypes algorithm
Source title: International Journal of Innovative Technology and Exploring Engineering
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ranti, K.S., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Salim, K., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Yuliyono, A.D., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Girsang, A.S., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Understanding the customer sentiment is very important when it comes to advertising. To appeal to their current and potential customers, a company must understand the market interests. Companies can segment their customers by using surveys and telemetry data to get to know the customer’s interests. One way of segmenting the customer is by grouping or clustering them according to their interests and behaviors. In this study, the k-prototypes clustering algorithm, which is an improved combination of k-means and k-modes algorithm, will be used to cluster a behavioral data that contains both numerical and categorical attribute, obtained from a survey conducted on teenagers into clusters of 4, 5, and 6. Each cluster will contain teenagers with certain behavior different from other clusters. And then by analyzing the results, advertisers will be able to define a profile that indicates their interests regarding the internet, social media and text messaging, effectively revealing the kind of ad that would be relatable for them. © BEIESP.
Author Keywords: Behavioral data; Cluster Analysis; Interest; K-Prototypes
